p: Zhou et al. [ 131] validated a GCÃ—GC-TOFMS method to quantify odour compounds in cigarette smoke, identifying 169 compounds (134 tentatively identified). The main classes contributing to cigarette aroma were alcohols, aldehydes, ketones, acids, pyrroles and pyrazines. Good sensitivity enabled identification of four low-content compounds ( t- t-farnesol, 2-acetyl-5-methylfuran, isoforone and 2,3,5,6-tetramethylpyrazine).
